name: cifti-gradient
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Take gradient of a cifti file.

Performs gradient calculation on each component of the cifti file, and optionally averages the resulting gradients.  The -vectors and -average-output options may not be used together.  You must specify a surface for each surface structure in the cifti file.  The COLUMN direction should be faster, and is the direction that works on dtseries.  For dconn, you probably want ROW, unless you are using -average-output.

inputs.name: direction
inputs.description: which dimension to take the gradient along, ROW or COLUMN

inputs.name: left_surface
inputs.description: specify the left surface to use

type.name: left_surface
type.description: specify the left surface to use

inputs.name: opt_left_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the left surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: right_surface
inputs.description: specify the right surface to use

type.name: right_surface
type.description: specify the right surface to use

inputs.name: opt_right_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the right surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: cerebellum_surface
inputs.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

type.name: cerebellum_surface
type.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

inputs.name: opt_cerebellum_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the cerebellum surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

inputs.name: opt_surface_presmooth_surface_kernel
inputs.description: smooth on the surface before computing the gradient: the size of the gaussian surface smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

inputs.name: opt_volume_presmooth_volume_kernel
inputs.description: smooth on the surface before computing the gradient: the size of the gaussian volume smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

inputs.name: opt_presmooth_fwhm
inputs.description: smoothing kernel sizes are FWHM, not sigma

inputs.name: opt_average_output
inputs.description: output the average of the gradient magnitude maps instead of each gradient map separately

inputs.name: opt_vectors_vectors_out
inputs.description: output gradient vectors: the vectors, as a dscalar file

output-files.name: opt_vectors_vectors_out
output-files.description: output gradient vectors: the vectors, as a dscalar file
